caption: Charming wood fire pizza place. Best part you get to see pizza being made on the way to your seat!
This place is just a walk away from my apartment. Convenient for me to take away any meal.
The pizza is so perfectly light and simple and delicious! The setting is lovely, too. I just moved to the area and have deemed this my fav neighborhood spot.
(Translated by Google) It's good service  (Original) Es buen servicio
WONDERFUL!!
Good gluten free pizza
This pizza is fresh and tasty.
Pizza is VERY good and service is always super nice.
Really good neopolitan style pizza.
I honestly like their food and service, awesome location next to where I live. The employees are always super nice. Would recommend to others.
Service was great food was very good

The Pizza arrived so quickly & was deliciously warm!  Excellent thin crust pizza!  I will definitely order from Sottacasa at least once a week from now on!!! And the prices are reasonable!  Very impressed!
I ordered a simple margarita pizza and the bottom was burned. Never ordering again, very disappointed:-(
Perfect Neapolitan pizza crust.
One of the best pizzas I've had in my life. The staff is really nice, too. Highly recommended.
My favorite pizza in NYC! Very cozy and intimate dining experience as well.
I fall in love woth these places they were so kind to us i really recommend to friends and family
Waiters were very nice and the food was great
Fantastic pizza!
Best pizza I've had in Brooklyn. Super authentic. Great wine selection. Fast service.
No cheese because I was broke and it was still pretty good
Long time favorite.  Great pizza and atmosphere. Great place to eat very clean environment and a great and friendly staff.

As someone who only eats gluten-free pizza, I can say with confidence that is the THE BEST I’ve ever had in NYC. My non-gluten-free friends can’t even tell the difference. The dough is pillowy soft and chewy with the right amount of crispy crunch. The REGINELLA is my absolute favorite. The buffalo mozzarella makes the pizza even more delicious. If you’re looking for outstanding pizza you’ve come to the perfect place.

My boyfriend found this place and recommended it having been to their sister site in Manhattan. It's a little downstairs place with just one table in front. We were afraid that we would have to eat on the run, but they have a little outdoor garden in the back. Awesome and cute. So, cut to the food, sooo good. We started with a Tagliere (meat and cheese plate) and we were warned that it was a lot. No problem for us as we had been biking all day. The homemade focaccia, the meats and cheese were awesome and filling. But, that didn't stop us from having a main course. We shared a special salad of Watermelon, Feta and Balsamic Reduction with a Salsiccia Pizza (fresh mozz, Italian sausage, basil). We didnt have room for dessert after all that and washing it down with two S. Pellegrino Arancini each. So, we'll be back. In the mean ti.e, grab yourself some.awesome wood-fired pizza.
Everything so fresh and good

I tried their Olive brick oven pizza, and I loved it. I never had a brick oven pizzas before and yesterday I decided to try a take out and guess what i found them on Google top results. I tried their pizza with Olives, mushrooms and especially that soft crust. Kudos to that awesome chef who made my pizza. @Sottocasa Pizzaria, give your chef a raise. Most of the Pizzarias are closed but your guys are still giving take outs and I appreciate it. Definitely gonna try 2nd time and thank the owner and the chef personally. Cheers!  Update: tried it for the 2nd time, loved it.  Update: tried their Sweet Onions & Zucchini pizza
no good for me
It’s my go-to pizza place.  Great salads and desserts too.  Pizza as good as in Italy.
Very friendly staff, but not too much excited about what we had, probably it is my fault of making the order

the food was fine. But the lady with glasses and short hair who waited us was acting very condescending and rude the moment we stepped in. She rushed us to order a billion times and seemed quite annoyed to "deal" with us..... who do you think you are? Honestly me and my parents just wanted to get a pizza on a snowy day. I guess doesn't need to be here. Or maybe she shouldn't to be here, because we thought the cook was nice. There are plenty of entries around. Avoid.

Pleasantly surprised. The pizza was just a bit soggy but tasty and the salad was good but I must say the Follina beer was transcendent. I'm not a beer lover but I loved this one. Made everything better. Would I say worth the trip? Maybe not. But if your in the neighborhood then stop by and have one amazing beer.
Food was amazing, staff was all so kind. This place is what you want from an Italian pizza spot!
Love the place, and the personnel and owners are the most welcoming. The food is just brilliant!
We split 2 different pizzas and both were delicious.  The endive salad was perfect to share.
Delicious napoletano pizza, good wine and friendly service. Definitely worth a visit here or @ Harlem location - very consistent experience.  BK location has a beautiful backyard area too!
Visited the place a few times now. Delicious pizzas and great service, attentive and quick. Nice vibe and not loud at all. Ideal for a relaxing night out with family or friends.
very cozy space, great pizza, fast and friendly service!
The food was okay,  not good, not bad.  Frozen pizza from trader Joe's was better.  So,  will not come back again

One of my favorite pizza places in the city - hands down. Came here on a pizza tour and love the thinner crust and how quickly it's made. The classic margarita is my recommendation but they're all fresh tasting.
Quaint with excellent food and service. Highly recommend. Intimate little restaurant.
A little bit small but pizza is great
This place provides excellent service as well as delightful food. The best place in town. The food came out quick and the rates are economical. Highly recommended.
Great spot for a pizza. It's cooked well and the ingredients are fresh. It didn't blow my mind but it was solid. Would definitely recommend.  Pizza Adventures: Destination #108
It was good, just GOOD.
I tried a few different kinds of pizza here and it was all really great. I wasn't as impressed by the dessert options.
Found this place on our trip to the city for Christmas, and it was a very lucky find! Tasty food and amazing service in a really cool space - hoping to get back again soon!!
Especially, dough is very awsome.
Incredible food, good service and reasonably priced
Delicioso. Loved that they had a vegan option.
(Translated by Google) Excellent pizza!  (Original) Pizza eccellente!
Great pizza, great dessert, great staff, if you like real Italian food then you'll love here.

A wonderfully fresh and authentic Italian pizza restaurant! Very friendly staff and prompt service. Nice Italian wine selection. Definitely get your own pizza or multiple pizzas if sharing...you will want to finish every last slice! Dessert was delicious - try the tartufo.
My favorite pizza! No question!
Great pizza freshly made and cooked when you order. Lovely atmosphere and good service

(Translated by Google) Outstanding Pizza, boys cordial and welcoming. A genuine piece of Italy in the heart of Brooklyn.  (Original) Pizza eccezionale, ragazzi cordialissimi e accoglienti. Un angolo autentico di Italia nel cuore di Brooklyn.
Cracking place. Good food and lovely staff
Great Gluten Free pizza!!
Delicious hand made Italian pizza, run by lovely people. Save room for dessert, the tiramisu and panettone are a must have!
Great pizzas and the tiramisu is fantastic! Wonderful selection of Italian microbrews too.
Love this neighborhood spot serving really high quality pizzas and antipasti.

Love the margarita here have had countless times, thank you. Unfortunately tried the option with vegan mozzarella last time, which was an extra $3 and not the same at all - contrary to what the staff suggested before ordering too. Ended up having to buy another whole pizza - pity.
Absolutely delicious! True Italian taste. Definitely recommend.
Awesome pizza
One of the best pizza places in Brooklyn!
Great place to have a pizza. Overall the pizza were unique and quite tasty.
We went with the recommended dishes, even the dessert. Everything was fantastic. We will return again.
(Translated by Google) Porcodio if it's good ...  (Original) Porcodio se è buona...

(Translated by Google) Feeling in Italy eating pizza in Brooklyn is no small thing. Soft and well-risen dough. Top quality ingredients. The kind and thoughtful manager. When I return to New York I know where to eat pizza. Congratulations!  (Original) Sentirsi in Italia mangiando pizza a Brooklyn non è cosa da poco. Impasto morbido e ben lievitato. Ingredienti di prima qualità. Il gestore gentile e premuroso. Quando tornerò a New York so dove andare a mangiare la pizza. Complimenti!
Great Neopolitan style pizza in Brooklyn. Cozy place and good service
Best pizza in the neighborhood, friendly local joint.
Delicious Italian thin pizzas, cozy atmosphere.
Excellent!  Sono boni. Great ingredients make great pizzas
Delicious salads and pizzas.  Wonderful smiling server.  With the calzone, it would be more delicious with a side of pizza sauce to dip and eat.  There are many selections to choose from on the menu.
Great place! Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere, superb service!
Good pizza.
Great service, great food, quick seating. The atmosphere definitely enables a relaxed conversational dinner. The pies come out quickly and are high quality.
If you're a pizza officionado, then this place is a must!
(Translated by Google) Very good pizza and beer !! Competent and friendly managers! Highly recommended !!  (Original) Pizza e birra molto buone!! Gestori competenti e simpatici! Consigliatissimo!!
Serves up great pizzas. Would come again with family or meet some friends there for sure.
The best pizza I've ever had, and I've tried over 50 places. Service was impeccable, as was the pizza.
Small place. Great pizza, excellent italian desets
This is a very quaint sit down restaurant. Calzone was delicious. Service was very nice. One star off because the temperature of this location was very very hot on a cool late summer day.
Go to pizza place in the neighborhood
delicious! love that they offer violife vegan cheese (which is dairy and soy-free)! will definitely be back

Friendly, welcoming pizza is better than lots places in Italy. Beautiful garden in the back, great for family with children. I have been here 3 times and I always found my self very happy. I highly recommended it
Amazing pizzas!!!!

(Translated by Google) Very attractive and elegant place, even if in its simplicity. Professionalism and courtesy of the owner and staff. Pizza really good as the tiramisu made by Luca's mother, the owner. Highly recommended. You will not be disappointed.  (Original) Luogo molto attraente ed elegante, se pur nella sua semplicità. Professionalità e cortesia del proprietario e dello staff. Pizza veramente ottima come il tiramisù fatto dalla mamma di Luca, il proprietario. Da consigliare vivamente. Non rimarrete delusi.
(Translated by Google) Delicious pizza!  (Original) Pizza squisita!
Delicious pizza, tasty Chianti, sublime tiramisu. I also had the pleasure of talking to the owners and they are very nice and create a welcoming environment. I highly recommend this place.
Amazing Pizza, Appetizers and Desserts
Buratta pizza. very good
Amazing pizza. Get the Laura! Loved the ambiance. Wanted to just "be" there.

I can’t think of anywhere better to go for delicious and authentically Roman pizza. The atmosphere is gorgeous, service is quick, and the pizza is always the perfect taste and texture. I would recommend Sottocasa to anyone looking for an authentically Italian experience
(Translated by Google) Pizza, desserts, coffee and amazing service !! Highly recommended  (Original) Pizza, dolci, caffè e servizio strepitosi!! Consigliatissima
Very good Nepolitan pizza. The atmosphere is nice but this a hidden gem.
Oh Napolitana style pizza! You just gotta try it! It's different but it's soooooooo yummmmy! And the backyard makes it even better on a cooler evenings tho too!
Best pizza in New York
This is honestly one of the best places in the city. True pizzeria owned and operated by Italians!
The pizza is excellent, the staff is friendly, and the wine selection is pretty good. Great for casual groups.
Two day dough, old world oven and a fantastic tasting pie.

(Translated by Google) ... Italian Pizzeria, owned by Italians, who also speak French! Delicious pizzas, incredible dough, thick without too much, crisp and mellow, fresh and quality ingredients, a treat! Take-away sales, very little waiting on the spot!  (Original) ... Pizzeria italienne, tenue par des italiens, qui parlent aussi français ! Pizzas délicieuses, pâte incroyable, épaisse sans trop, croustillante et moelleuse, ingrédients frais et de qualité, un régal ! Ventes à emporter, très peu d'attente sur place !
Very yummy pizza in a fun, funky neighborhood spot.  I don't think there will ever be an official winner for best pizza in New York, but this place is definitely worth a trip if you are in the area.
Great service and pizza!
Good pizza

Great pizza but sadly waitress rushed us through which kind of ruined our night .place was even busy .But good was good so if its just eat and run this is first class joint if it's a night with friends ...not so good 👎

Food was good but what the waiter did was wrong. I was sitting with my arm resting on the tables chair next to our table and the waiter picked up the chair and moved it abruptly knocking my elbow off it. Not evening and apologizing. He then moved the table more over. I thought someone was going to sit on it. Nope. UNBELIEVABLY RUDE!!!!

The restaurant has a weird smell, so I decided to take a table in the outdoor space at the back of the restaurant. The pizza was ready very quickly, yet, it was barely warm. There were a lot of liquid on the plate. Was it frozen? The taste was average, something that you could get from any local pizza joint for less. The desert was goos. The wait staff was very friendly. However, one of the waitresses there should cover her long loose hair. Judging by feedback from the management to other negative reviews, they will twist it somehow to make the reviewer look bad, instead of addressing the issues and improving its operations. so this review is more of a warning to other people.
Fantastic flavors. Do it!
Delicious pizza and friendly service
Ambience, staff like a and of course the Pizza.
Friendly and fast service, best and most authentic pizza of its kind in the neighborhood

Their pizza is delicious, the menu is expansive, and the wait staff doesn't rush you. They know how to properly serve wine, and the staff is very knowledgeable of their whole menu. We go here a lot for client-type dinners since it is intimate and a good value.

Delicious pizza! Good, quick service. Nice space. We had the buffalo margarita, marscopone and speck and a marinara. They were all great! Not very busy when we went around 5:30 on Thursday. Eat the pizza there though - it's a bit soggy as is. I can't imagine it would hold up well for takeout.

(Translated by Google) If you feel like eating a good NY pizza, you can only go to Sottocasa pizzeria, run by Italians with Italian pizza and talented. I was in New York a week and I always ate the same things New Yorkers, from hot dog street, hamburgers ... but one day I told myself that it was time to eat a great pizza. Luke, the pizza is well prepared in terms of real Italian pizza, took a daisy with sausage that was a show ... and finally an excellent tiramisu, which brought me back with the thought at home !! nothing but American food !! I highly recommend everyone to go Sottocasa!  (Original) Se vi viene voglia di mangiare una buona pizza a NY, non potete che andare alla pizzeria Sottocasa, gestita da italiani, con pizzaiolo italiano e bravissimo. Sono stata a NY una settimana ed ho sempre mangiato le solite cose newyorkesi, dall'hot dog per strada, agli hamburger... ma per un giorno mi sono detta che era arrivato il momento di mangiare un'ottima pizza. Luca, il pizzaiolo, è molto preparato in fatto di vere pizze italiane, presi una margherita con la salsiccia che era uno spettacolo... e per finire un ottimo tiramisù, che mi ha riportato con il pensiero a casa!! altro che cibo americano!! Consiglio vivamente a tutti di andare da Sottocasa!
Great pizza, nice atmosphere.
Delicious and healthy food. Highly recommended for those who enjoy savory foods but don't want to splurge on calories
Good pizza
I have Probablyteied pizza in all 5 boroughs in NY. This place has by far the best pizza in the city. The place is family friendly, the pizza is top notch, and the service is stellar and fast.
Authentic pizza, friendly staff. Great local spot.
(Translated by Google) A simple place Fast attention. Reasonable price / quality  (Original) Un lugar simple. Atención rápida. Precio/Calidad razonable.
Pizza was great.wine was good. Staff was very attentive. Worth the visit from long island to Brooklyn
Neapolitan style. Good for the style, but not my jam
Yum. Some of the best pizza in the city!
Amazing pizza and artisanal Italian beer. Tartufo pizza is a must. White pizzas are served very quickly.

The restaurant, the host , the staff, the atmosphere ...and, last but not least, the pizza , make Sottocasa a must. This is authentic Italian (neapolitan ) pizza ; it’s made with organic tomatoes;  it’s never too cheesy, nor too dry , the wood burning oven gives the dough that necessary crispness. Don’t go if you’re looking for that ( pretty bad indeed ) New York style pizza. Pizza was invented in Italy ...choose the best instead. Discrete selection of wines and deliciously cold draft beer from Brooklyn. If you bring your kids , indulge in the famous Nutella pizza for dessert, they will love you forever...
Great pizza!

(Translated by Google) excellent, very good pizza, fast service, very nice place especially the outside part.  (Original) eccellente, pizza buonissima, servizio veloce, locale molto carino specialmente la parte dietro all'esterno.
Pizza and calzones are great!

The male host provided great service. The pizza was overpriced and IMO bland. Perhaps it was just the pizza I chose, but I don't reccommend if you're seeking authentic NY style pizza. Noticed that they have gluten free and vegan options.

I love the pizza but especially the atmosphere. Once I walked into the restaurant I was immediately greeted and felt welcomed. Next I was seating asked anything to drink and given a menu. The menu was fun and straight forward. I ordered a simple margherita and it came under 10 minutes. It was very fast and the sauce was spectacular. I would highly recommend

Amazing across the board - great pizzas delivered with no fuss or pretension.  In another city, this place would be worshiped and mobbed by pizza enthusiasts.  In Brooklyn, this place is casual and fun, with a great back patio enclosed in an all glass greenhouse with hanging drapes.  And they take credit cards!!! A real gem.
Soggiest wet undercooked pizza I have ever had. Any local half decent by the slice pizzeria is light years better quality than the pizza here. Confused by the good reviews honestly...
Amazing Brooklyn Pizza!

Pizzas are delicious! Their desserts are pretty good, I love tiramisu and panna cotta. They have another restaurant in uptown Manhattan, I prefer the uptown one since the service and environment are better.
Suggested with seal of approval from an Italian friend who is very tough on Italian food out of Italia lol  Approved!
Great service delicious 😋 pizzazz
Tasty, oven-baked Neopolitan pizza. Classic downtown spot.
What a great place for excellent pizzas ! Better than all the fancy places where you have to line up for hours to get a table !! They also deliver very fast. Try the fresca and the Nutella pizzas....
Good Pizzas. Not classic NY pizza if that's what you want.
Very good place to eat in Brooklyn
Awesome brick oven pizza, individually served, Brooklyn style.
Great pizza!! This is my favorite pizza place. It's not greasy new york pizza and I love it! It's such a quaint lil place. The outdoor seating is awesome too
Great pizza 👌
It was amazing!!! Great pizza and awesome service
Amazing pizza and calzones! Great with our toddler too.
BEST PIZZA IN NY , I don't care what anybody says !
Delicious pizza in Brooklyn but beer prices are insane!! $12us without taxes for a very small beer.
Pizza was absolutely amazing. Thin crust, crispy but not burned, tomato sauce tangy and fresh, service was friendly and warm. Highly recommended.
Pizza was decent
Good food, pizza was just the tiny bit too wet.
Good zah.
Overpriced for mediocre pizza
Great pizza
The best gluten-free pizza I have ever eaten. Ever.
had four cheese. delicious.  will come back again.
So overpriced for just a Neapolitan style pizza. Nothing special
Traditional NY pizza. Love it.
very good pizza; good drink selection; cozy, intimate environment
Awesome, thin, simple pizzas. Service was very friendly and the space feels cozy without being super cramped.
The pizzas were great and the staff was very friendly and accommodating! Thoroughly recommended if you're looking for a nice place to have dinner!
Delicious pizza and wine, the service was REALLY FAST, really surprised of how italian is the preparation and the taste. Plus the service staff was nice and helpful.

This place is good. But it’s expensive and you have to wait for a table and for your food around 20 m each. When I say expensive, I mean expect to spend at least $40 per person only for a personal pizza and two glasses of wine. Just keep that in mind. The pizza and the gluten free pizza are pretty good, in any case. But be patient and expect to spend some money.
Nice place
Incredible pizzas here and a great staff. Can't recommends it enough.
(Translated by Google) Good pizza to be in NY, friendly and professional staff. Salty account  (Original) Pizza buona per essere a NY, personale gentile e professionale. Conto salato
Best gluten free pizza in Brooklyn
Best pizza ever
(Translated by Google) Excellent pizza recommended local run by Italians ..... great Mery thanks  (Original) Ottima pizza consigliatissimo locale gestito da italiani.....grande Mery grazie
Great neighborhood Neapolitan pizza spot. Small, cozy, excellent food.
Excellent authentic neapolitan style pizza. Chewy, charred crust with just the right amount of toppings.
(Translated by Google) A perfect place  (Original) Un lugar perfecto
Go to this place.
Perfect pizza every time.

We were pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the pizzas here, rivaling those you find on the streets of Napoli. High quality ingredients and very nicely done base, just like true Napolitean pizza. Pizzas and drinks are a bit pricey, but in my opinion totally justified in light of the very good service, nice atmosphere and top-notch pizzas. Show less
This place is amazing! All the pizzas are excellent. They have gluten free option. It is well priced. The owners are really kind and friendly. I really recommend this place.
Tasty, non pretentious, genuine Italian food with good prices in an easy setting. Deserts taste great as well!!
Now our regular spot every Sunday. Incredible pizzas, literally all of them.
Best pizza in the world!
Great food, great service.  Not what I expected, but excellent all the same.  They even opened a little early to accommodate our very large group.

(Translated by Google) Very good pizza in Brooklyn. They give you a jug of water before anything else, which is appreciated when you haven't stopped walking !! No wifi  (Original) Pizza muy rica en Brooklyn. Te ponen jarra de agua antes de nada, lo cual se Agradece cuando no has parado de andar!! No hay wifi

Quick, and kind servers. Very clean, warm atmosphere, and FANTASTIC PIZZA!!! It was done relatively fast too. It’s a little pricey but it’s worth it I assure you. I’ll definitely be coming here more often!
Quite good, including a better than average gluten free crust.
Favorite pizza in NYC
Always great go to place for delicious thin crust pizza
Always delightful.  A fave.
Just discovered this place after living in the hood for over a year. Incredible Neapolitan style pies. A simple menu and space overall - the pizza is the star.
Amazing!

I loved this pizza, I ran into this place and they were so kind from the get. I was seated and after. Ordered it seemed like 5 min or less passed and a pizza was delivered to my table. Great selections of pizza and wine.
The pizza I had here was delicious! I had a burata pizza that is only served on a certain day of the week.

This is a very low key pizza place. I think that a lot of people will come here and enjoy some of their pizza. I thought it was really delicious and the flavors that I tasted were so good. It was not unique though. There are many pizzas that use the same type of sauce and they taste the same. But, that should not take away from the amazing food that we had here. I went here with my wife and we had such a great time. I felt so full when I left this place. All of the food was good and all of the people there were kind. It was definitely a fun experience and I would repeat it if I got the chance.

Good sized single pizzas that taste great. My table asked for parm cheese. They gave us a very tiny amount in a fancy ketchup container. It wasn't much, so we asked for more. Only after we got the bill did we find out each one was a $1.50
Real Napolitan pizza margherita and cappuccinos. Delicious!
Cozy and and amazing margherita pizza. Try the amaro too. Best Italian pizza I've ever had.
A friendly warm setting with great food
Love this place, MariaRosa, Samielle and all of the staff are great, and the food, let's just say it's fantastic
Great Neopolitan style pizza, consistently fresh and friendly folk too. The Laura pizza is our favorite.
So authentic and delicious.  Right around the corner from Brooklyn Tabernacle. Made for a great Sunday dinner

Most delicious pizza i have ever tasted. We visited mid August and went here after a walk from Manhattan over the Brooklyn bridge was about a 10/15 min walk from the bridge. lovely little restaurant with a great atmosphere the pizza was amazing and the pudding was every bit as nice. Definitely worth a visit.
Massive servings. Split a pizza between at least 2 people because they’re pretty big.
I love it
Went for pizza considering so many good reviews especially for the crispness of the dough... we ordered two pizzi and the dough was soggy on both.. nice service though.
Best pizza in town! Very authentic and nice music!
Decent pizza nothing to die for

As individuals used to greasy American pizza, we found this more authentic Italian fare a pleasant change of pace. The pizza was light and airy and the crust was undeniably the star of the show as it boasted the perfect amount of char. The sauce was subtle and complemented the cheese and toppings well. It's a pizza that undoubtedly makes you feel guilt free for it is not cloying. Our prosciutto and mozzarella appetizer was fresh and the olive oil was a nice complement. The tiramisu was some of the best I've ever had. The service was attentive but not obtrusive and the atmosphere cozy. One star was deducted solely for the fact that they do not have air conditioning and frankly, I find it hard to thoroughly enjoy any meal when such is not present. It detracts from the ambiance and makes you want to leave quickly. Otherwise, we were satisfied with our experience.
Great pizza. Legit Italian service. Perfect.

Amazing napoletana pizza. Crust is incredible, pizza came back incredibly quickly, and the interior is very cute! They also have vegan violife cheese that can be added to any pizza for $2. Highly recommend and will return.
Great food, excellent and fast service. Surprisingly no line for good pizza in New York
Tge best pizza dough in Brooklyn!

Absolutely fantastic authentic neopolitain pizza. Spinach salad was enough for four people. Food was fresh and service was friendly and  fast. Great experience and highly recommend. Pizza will serve two or one famished individual.

Came to Brooklyn looking for good pizza and was blown away by this authentic pizzeria and restaurant. Service was fast right around supper time and the food was amazing. The restaurant itself has a lovely cozy interior and the staff are friendly. Molto Bene!
Outstanding!
Very good ingredients and the pizza was delicious, crust was just a little soggy! Otherwise, perfection!
Yummy pizza!
Best pizza in NYC!!
Best pizza in Brooklyn! 🍕

I have a bad experience with this place. The croast of my pizza came really burnt, like really really burnt. The smell if burnt made almost impossible to eat - I ended up eating basically the toppings. When I asked the server to come see how burnt it was, she said that the pizza was supposed to be that way. Trying to avoid any discussion, I said ok. But then she came back and insisted that I could have another one. Then one of the owners came to table and said the same. I said it was ok, since the next pizza would come in the same way (that's the way they do the pizza right?). I know a lot of people have good experience here, but that wasn't my case.
We sat outside in the greenhouse. Nice atmosphere. Very good pizza. Friendly service.
Amazing food and great Italian beers. Must visit for everyone!
As authentic Italian as it gets
Not great, under cooked wet pizza. Flavors weren't bad.

First time here and glad we checked it out. Pizza was cooked very well on a thinner type crust. Great crunch and not soggy like you get with a lot of thin crust style pizzas. Price was a little on the higher end as 2 mediums ran me close to $50 but the pizzas were good. :)
Some of the best pizza in Brooklyn!
Slightly overpriced and the service was not so friendly but good pizza and nice atmosphere overall.
Awesome focaccia and pizza

The food and service were great.  I ordered a single margherita pizza which was $14 and had water to drink. At the end my total was about $17 with tax and I tipped $4 for the meal which is just under 25%. However when I looked at my bank statement a few days later I had been charged $36 by the restaurant basically implying a 100% tip. I am pretty sure the amount written by me on my receipt was modified. While I did get a refund credit from my bank after explaining the situation, the entire incident left a very sour taste in my mouth.  Will not be returning.
Super relax. Great food. Can't believe it took this long for me to get here. Yum
Would have been 5 star, but both pies were really imbalanced (all basil on one slice).  Great Italian craft beer selection.
Great pizza. The chick pea salad was also very good.
Amazing pizza.
We have been here twice now and the food comes at an amazing speed. It's a great place to go with hungry kids. The service and food are equally excellent. Highly recommend!!
Good

We went there for lunch as we were having a relaxed walk around Brooklyn, basically, because it was rated 4.5 in Google. Fantastic place. Really nice home-made pizzas. Well priced according to its top quality. Five stars, absolutely!
This place reminded us of Italia!  Great food and wine. Really enjoyed it.  Pizza was like the pizza in Italy.
Great pizza. Casual atmosphere.

Pretty good pizza. Solid 4-stars, but not “da best” in Brooklyn, or NYC, or heaven-forbid “outside of Italy” as some people have claimed. The pie has a Naan-like texture: thin and elastic (not crispy) — I wish it were tad chewier. We had three different pizzas: the Burrata, the Parmigiana, and the Tartufata. The Parmigiana was quite good but was lacking a bit of toppings (lots of white space on the pie). The Tartufata was our favorite, with ample prosciutto on top. The pizza arrived very quickly and the service was attentive. I’d probably stop by again for a casual bite if I were in the neighborhood. Other than that, I wouldn’t make a special trip visiting here.
Pizza Doesn’t get better than this
Authentic food

Very fast, so good if your in a hurry but dissapointed with the pizza. Raw mushrooms and raw garlic toppings were cold on the warm pizza sauce. Strangely the basil leaves were burnt to a blackened crisp instead of added after cooking. Tables packed in Soo tight you have to rearrange the furniture to get in or out.
Solid pizza. I feel the topping and cheese ratio to crust is slightly low; there are tons of pictures of the pizza online, so you can judge yourself.
Excellent pizza!!!!

(Translated by Google) A very good place for pizza's lovers! Lovely REAL italian pizzas and a very good service! Many languages ​​spoken by the crew A very good place for pizza lovers! Very good REAL Italian pizzas and very good service! Several languages ​​spoken by the team.  (Original) A very good place for pizza's lovers! Lovely REAL italian pizzas and a very good service! Many languages spoken by the crew Une très bonne place pour les amateurs de pizzas! De très bonne VRAIS pizzas italiennes et une très bon service! Plusieurs langues parlées par l'équipe.
(Translated by Google) Good pizza and very fast service!  (Original) Bonne pizza et service très rapide !
Best pizza I've had in a while.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Best pizza I ever had!

Best Italian pizza in Brucklyn. Good beer and  a superb selection of Italian wines. The food and exlecialy pizza was excellent as was the service and atmosphere. Highly recommended! They have a backyard, best choice during spring and summertime.

My boyfriend and I came across this lovely pizzeria, because I googled cheapest pizza in New York. And it was, therefore we had no expectations. However, we were blown away! The service is fantastic!! Our pizzas came in 6 min, even though the restaurant was a bit busy! We sat “outside” which is more of a Wintergarden/greenhouse. The atmosphere was just lovely, as if we have left the city and gone on holiday abroad. Oh and the taste was very Italian. I enjoyed every second there and I can only recommend this to everyone who pizza. It’s worth the ride from anywhere!
Best pizza in New York! There is no doubt!
Pizza here was amazing.  Fresh creamy cheese and tangy tomatoes.  Highly recommend.  Also get the Nutella Focaccia with almonds.  Perfect combo!

I probably eat a pie from here twice a month or more. The Quattro Fromaggio is one of our favorites. It’s a great neighborhood spot that has insanely fast service - I swear we order, and the waitstaff walks back to our table in less than 5 minutes with steaming hot pizzas fresh from the oven.
Italian owned, great pies. Food comes out super fast. Fresh ingredients. Great local spot for pizzas.
Great pizza, affordable. Overall a really good place in the neighborhood. Comfortably finished the pie myself. ( Don't know what that says about me.)
Great pizza.  Arrogant server.
Delicious with a lot of options. They have gluten free pizza too cooked in the same oven as regular pizza.  Olive oil is surprisingly extra delicious too if you dip the crust in it!
Fantastic pizza and amazing staff. Trust the menu!

The restaurant is a lot larger in the inside then it appears when you walk in with outdoor/covered seating in the back.  The servers here are super friendly and it’s a great environment to come relax and have a pizza with a drink.  However …
Superb place. Just what we needed after a long day in Manhattan. Wonderful staff and the food is excellent
Excellent pizzas, kids friendly, service is fast and nice. Love it !
Great spot.  Well organized.  Treats to take home.
Best Italian Piazza in town. The place is nice and cozy and the personal is always very kind. Great selection of wines and beers and how not to mention the fantastic homemade Tiramisu'.
Went to the Brooklyn location and loved it! Absolutely fantastic pizza.
Great pizza and great beer. The waiter was a little bit annoying.

Best Pizza outside of Italy. Staff is very friendly and professional. Come here on a Monday or Tuesday and you dont have to wait for a seat. Staff speaks Italian which adds to the great atmosphere. A must see if you are in Brooklyn.
Good price, good service, good beer selection.  Pizza was soggy considering how highly rated it is.
Delicious pizza.
The best pizza on New York City. Good selection of beers.
Very Nice Naples style pizza. One small restaurant around Brooklyn downtown.

(Translated by Google) The pizzas are individual. A delight! Simple but cozy atmosphere. I loved that ambient music is Italian radio.  (Original) As pizzas são individuais. Uma delícia! Ambiente simples mas aconchegante. Amei que a música ambiente é a rádio italiana.
Thin but spongy crist; delicious. Large selection of Italian beer.
Real Italian pizza spot with a great staff
Delicious pizza! The salads are wonderful too

I love this place! I stumbled on it my first time in Brooklyn when I just googled "pizza", and was very pleasant surprised to discover it is authentic Napolitano pizza! Their pizza oven is brick wood fired, and the pizza is just absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend for the most authentic Italian pizza experience you will get in the US.

I ordered a personal pizza pie and a glass of wine and asked if they could swap out the sausage for a less expensive vegetable option since their vegetarian options are shoddy. I'm not a vegetarian but just wasn't in the mood for something too heavy. Anyway, the rude waiter said that they "don't adjust pies." What are they, pre-made?? Then he said for an EXTRA FEE they can do it. So my small SEVENTEEN DOLLAR PIZZA came up to TWENTY instead. Add the wine, it was a THIRTY DOLLAR SNACK. If this place wants to have inflexible nonsense rules and hire rude waiters, guess who's not coming back? A LOT of people. Change your policies. Restaurants should NEVER boast inflexible menus. Restaurants should be warm & catering - especially Italian ones ... which this barely is. It's a pizzeria. The gorgonzola doesn't make you fancy.
Excellent authentic Italian thin crust pizzería run by Italians.
They literally kicked me off 4min after closing time, very bad service and very pricy for not an awesome place
Amazing pizza. Overpriced beer
Great pizza. Try the Diavola and the Capricciosa. Cool atmosphere and nice setting.
My New Yorker friend's fav pizza place. Rustic pizzas were baked in stone oven. Truly comforting. Great vibe and the place is hugely popular. Service is prompt. Go early.
Mediocre pizza. Very soggy

Not your everyday pizza joint. This is Amazing pizza. Simply the best pizza I have found in NYC. THIN crust, superb ingredients, and a great wine list with excellent recommendations as what wine will pair well with you're pizza of choice.  Do not wait. Go NOW.
Excellent pizza. Price is steep though
Best pizza in the neighborhood. The prosciutto crudo is my favorite and the specials are always exceptional.
Best pizza in Boreum Hill/Brooklyn Heights/Cobble Hill neighborhoods.  If they have anything with bufala burrata when you’re there – order it.
Very casual spot good for quiet night out

Great food.  Great setting.  Friendly staff.
Great pizza...good crust.
our favorite pizza spot in Brooklyn!  Delicious pizza, salads, wine and dessert!  Warm and friendly staff and great ambiance with nice garden area in the back.  Great neighborhood restaurant!
Great pizza and somewhat unique beer selection.  Not overly pricey, but not cheap either.  Atmosphere is of a nicer place, but not super fancy.
Hot, thin and tasty pizza every visit!
(Translated by Google) Exceptional. Highlighting the white truffled pizza!  (Original) Excepcional. A destacar la pizza trufada blanca!

Great pizza. The Popeye was delicious. Had the gluten free version; I'm sure the regular dough is even better. The sauce is sweet and delicious. I could tell the ingredients were very fresh.  The prosciutto and mozzarella appetizer was good quality.
Amazing atmosphere! Great pizza and service, friendly and you can feel at home
The best Italian pizza ever
Very very Good pizza and Nice place

Excellent pizza, combined with excellent service it doesn't get nuch better than that...
Good pizza but yes.. attitude.. Not a good companion
Good from appetizer to dessert!

After returning from Milan and Naples, I was eager to get my hands on another New York Neapolitan pie or two. I ordered up the Aglio, Olio (crushed red pepper, garlic, oil, ricotta on a white pie) and a traditional margherita. Not the best …
Delicious

Cute, friendly bright atmospher. Modern Neapolitan style pizza. Lots of veggie options. And the drink list is amazing. Best italian beers and wines. All super unique and geeky.  My got to spot with friends or for laid back date.
Fabulous pizza and excellent Italian microbrews. Absolutely love this place!
We showed up 15 minutes before they closed but made us the most delicious pizza!!!
SORYY BUT I DID NOT LIKE IT
This place is tasty and the wine menu is perfect! Make sure to order a bottle and dessert.
